body_content.explanation: to push a loose end of a piece of clothing or material into a particular place or position, especially to make it tidy or comfortable:
examples: Should I tuck my shirt into my trousers?
He tucked the bottom of the sheet under the mattress.

body_content.explanation: to put something into a safe or convenient place:
examples: Tuck your gloves in your pocket so that you don't lose them.
She had a doll tucked under her arm.
Eventually I found the certificate tucked under a pile of old bills.
Tuck your chair in (= put it so that the seat of it is under the table) so that no one trips over it.

body_content.explanation: to hold part of your body in a particular position:
examples: Stand up straight, tuck your tummy in and tuck your bottom under.
She sat with her legs tucked under her.

body_content.explanation: to be in a place that is hidden or where few people go:
examples: Tucked along/down this alley are some beautiful old houses.

body_content.explanation: a narrow fold sewn into something, especially a piece of material, either for decoration or to change its shape
an operation to remove unwanted fat from a part of the body:
(in sports such as diving, gymnastics, or skiing) a position in which you bend your knees and keep them close to your chest:
examples: This video will show you how to do a standing back tuck.
He began with an inward three and a half somersaults dive with tuck.
